Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; single added white band below; exterior: painted decoration consisting of boar attacked by lion (on left, boar’s head with added red dots on cheek and snout, to right, with lion’s paw pressed against its forehead; above right, trace of lion’s lower jaw and tongue, and outline of chest); elaborate rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice-kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1). The number 886 is written in pencil on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 256, no. 451, pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1570) (phase 2)
